results.title: Report to the gods
results.creator_credit: Brian Salt, David Marchbank and Hong Kong Film Unit
results.brief_description: A review of Hong Kong showing many aspects of life in the great city as seen through the eyes of a ‘household god’ who comes to life. He reports to the gods on what his family has achieved in the previous year, in the fields of education, housing and medicine, and in the making of all the fine things of the old world and all those of the new world.

results.title: Report from Queensland. No. 2. The Herds move in
results.brief_description: Looks at the beef export industry in Queensland. Shows how cattle are taken annually from Queensland to New South Wales for fattening and takes note of how more hardy strains of cattle are bing bred.

results.title: Reinforcement therapy
results.brief_description: Presents three experimental programs that apply learning therapy or operant conditioning, to the treatment of severely disturbed autistic children, to the training of retarded children and to the treatment of chronic schizophrenic adult patients.
results.description: Presents three experimental programs that apply learning therapy or operant conditioning, to the treatment of severely disturbed autistic children, to the training of retarded children and to the treatment of chronic schizophrenic adult patients.

results.title: Rehabilitation of Della Derlein
results.brief_description: Silent film documenting the case history of Della Derlein by Herbert Schoening MD. Della contracted meningitis resulting in deafness and paralysis and was admitted to the Kenny Institute. This film documents her rehabilitation showing the many disciplines involved and illustrates the successful outcome of the conservative steps, keeping the focus on the whole patient rather than on isolated parts of her body.

results.title: Refractories from earth and sea
results.brief_description: Tells the story of an industrial enterprise engaged in the production of refractories - the heat resistant materials used in the construction of equipment required to contain fire and heat, and the many uses of refractories, in lining furnaces, firegrates and atomic power-plants

results.title: Rediscovered harmonies
results.creator_credit: Lucien Peroisy and Sofidoc S A
results.brief_description: The origin of different musical instruments. The Music Instrumental du Conservatoire de Brussels has a large collection of instruments some dating from prehistoric times. The film uses this collection to present an insight into the origin of musical instruments and describes the development from the Middle Ages to the present.

results.title: Recognising strabismus
results.brief_description: In this film, opthalmologist John T. Flynn MD, describes and demonstrates the clinical procedure necessary to diagnose strabismus, by applying his “cover test” to infant, adolescent and adult sufferers. Strabismus, or unco-ordinated binocular vision, is a chronic medical condition which can lead to ambliopia (blindness without pathogenic or biological cause); strabismus may also mask a retinal blastoma or other serious ailment. Early diagnosis - especially for childhood sufferers - is crucial if the condition is to be corrected and/or prevented from becoming worse.

results.title: Real wild child: Australian rock music & culture 1950's-90's (PC & MAC)
results.brief_description: A wild, surreal, multimedia ride through five decades of Australian rock music, focusing on seven major eras. Stroll to the milkbar to experience the music of 1956-63. Sneak into a girl’s bedroom to find out what was happening there between 1964-68. Take a trip to the hippie’s house to discover the meaning of music during 1969-73. Front up to the TV studio to study the impact of what unfolded between 1974-77. Circle the perimeter of the room at the Hotel to get the low-down on the happenings of 1978-83. Gatecrash the nightclub to observe interesting phenomena occurring between 1984-89, until finally hauling your tired body into a deck chair in the 1990’s garage to conclude the exploration. Fabulously presented, with informative snippets of information, excellent graphics and soundtrack, as well as cameos by some of Australia’s most well known (and often notorious) identities. SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS: For Windows, 486 DX2/66 or better (Pentium recommended) running Windows 95 (recommended)/NT 4.0/Windows 3.1, 16 megabytes or more of RAM. Double speed or faster CD-ROM drive (Quad speed recommended), sound card (stereo 16-bit recommended), 640x480 Super VGA display (256 colour or better). For Macintosh 68040 or better (Power PC recommended) running Mac OS System 7.5 or later. 8 megabytes if application RAM, (ie. memory available after System requirements) double speed or faster CD-ROM drive (Quad speed recommended), 640x480 display (256 colour or better).

results.title: Readicut rugs
results.brief_description: Shows the birth of the world’s wool industry in England. Takes the viewer through the stages of rug-making from selected English wool to the manufacturing processes.
